Cast the pump spell on Atla Palani. Activate Mirror Entity a huge amount of times for X = 0 by holding priority. When the first activation resolves, all creatures you control except Atla die, causing her to trigger and flip into that many creatures from your library, since they were all eggs when they died. Let the activations resolve until Inferno Titan enters the battlefield; Inferno Titan triggers, target an opponent to deal 3 damage to them. Continue resolving activations until Kozilek enters the battlefield and subsequently dies with the next activation. Kozilek shuffles your graveyard, including the Inferno Titan, back into your deck, and you continue resolving Mirror Entity activations until everyone is dead.

With Saffi in play or in the graveyard we cast Crypt Champion without paying a red mana. When The Champion comes into play, we stack the triggers so that the reanimation effect resolves first. If Saffi is in the graveyard, we'll bring her back with the reanimation effect, if she's already in play we can have it fizzle. The Champion's second ability will then trigger, forcing us to sacrifice him because we didn't pay the red mana. In response we will sacrifice Saffi to her ability, targeting the Champion. The Champion dies and is immediatly brought back by Saffi's ability. We again stack the triggers so the reanimation effect resolves first and with it reanimate Saffi. Since we reanimated him and didn't pay a red mana to cast him, his second ability forces us to sacrifice him again. You can keep looping this for however long you want and simply stop it by not sacrificing Saffi to bring him back

Heat Shimmer in graveyard, or in hand with :mana2::manar: to cast it. Dockside Extortionist in hand with :mana1::manar: to cast it, or on the battlefield with :mana1::manawu::manar::manar: to mutate Vadrok. All other cards in hand. Dockside Extortionist generates 4+ treasures.

Cast Dockside Extortionist (generate 4 treasures). Spend the treasures to mutate Vadrok underneath Dockside Extortionist, so that the pile is nonlegendary. If Heat Shimmer is in graveyard, target it with Vadrok's mutate trigger. Cast Heat Shimmer, targeting the mutate pile to create a token copy of it. Dockside Extortionist text in the token pile triggers (generate 4 treasures). Cast Snap; put the pile with the Vadrok card in your hand and untap two lands. Spend the treasures to mutate Vadrok under the token pile (already with one Vadrok). Vadrok's mutate triggers twice; cast Heat Shimmer and Snap from your graveyard, resolving them in that order. Resolve Heat Shimmer, creating a token mutate pile with two Vadroks. Resolve Snap, bouncing the Vadrok card to hand. Repeat steps 5-8 infinitely, floating :mana2: each cycle. Vadroks in the token pile also build up for infinite Vadrok mutate triggers.

Atla on field equipped with Thornbite Staff. Ashnod's Altar on field. All other permanents in library. An extra creature.

Sacrifice a creature to Ashnod's Altar generating :manac::manac:. With Thornbite Staff's ability to untap Atla on the stack, pay :manac::manac: to activate her ability to create an egg token. Sacrifice the egg to Ashnod's Altar generating :manac::manac:, triggering Atla's ability and Thornbite Staff's untap ability. Untap Atla and resolve her ability, putting a creature from the top of your library onto the battlefield. Repeat steps 2-5 until you hit Ulamog, then sacrifice every creature with Ulamog being sacrificed last, shuffling your entire grave back into your deck. With this loop established, repeat until you hit Inferno Titan to ping your opponents repeatedly to death.

Cast the other instant. Cast Spelljack, targeting the instant. Thousand-Year Storm triggers; have copy target original Spelljack. Copy resolves. Spelljack (original) is removed from the stack. Cast Spelljack for free targeting the instant.  Thousand-Year Storm triggers; target Spelljack (original) with the copies. Repeat as desired. Eventually, target the instant with a Spelljack copy and target Spelljack (original) with another copy. Let the full stack resolve. Cast the instant from exile.  Thousand-Year Storm gets many copies. If desired, cast Spelljack from exile and have the copies target the original instant and the original Spelljack. The copies of the instant resolve, but you keep the two cards in exile to cast at any time for free.

If you can win the game with that instant being copied many times, do so.  Otherwise, whenever someone casts a spell, simply respond with the same process (instant, then Spelljack , then Spelljack , then Spelljack ...) until you have enough copies that you can exile their spell, the original instant, and the original Spelljack again.  Rinse and repeat.
